intro: Asterocephalus massonii, commonly known as the African star grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its tufted, grass-like foliage and produces small, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Asterocephalus massonii is also valued as a ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
